page.title: 09MARYKIRK COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: The job of a{Community Councillor is voluntary. The villages in one area are involved in community councilling. Monthly meetings are held in Laurencekirk involving the following villages-Auchenblae, Drumlithie, Fettercairn, Fourdon, Garvock, Laurencekirk, Luthermuir and Marykirk. The councillors deal with the complaints or requests they have heard during the last month. There is one annual meeting which the public attend. A complaint or request has to go through different stages-e.g. if a new street light is wanted on a dangerous corner it is discussed at the meeting then a request is made to the lighting department. Representatives can bring village matters to the attention of the{District}or{Regional Council through the Community Council.
